Upward Hyperlinks: [[Town Center]], [[Urban Center]], [[Good Neighborhood]], [[Accessory Live Works]]

Problem: Many projects do not require large financial resources, but can be incentivized by small "micro-grants." But these programs require careful design to ensure they deliver an effective set of incentives.
Discussion:
Discussion: A microgrant is a small sum of money distributed

for the purpose of creating a sustainable livelihood or microenterprise. While microfinance and other financial services are intended to serve the poor, many of the poorest are either too risk-averse to seek out a loan, or do not qualify for a microloan or other form of microcredit.
It can also refer to a grant that is low in value

Discussion: A microgrant is a small sum of money distributed for the purpose of creating a sustainable livelihood or microenterprise. While microfinance and other financial services are intended to serve the poor, many of the poorest are either too risk-averse to seek out a loan, or do not qualify for a microloan or other form of microcredit.

N/A

Persons in This Model
No Net Change

N/A

Incremental tax Income
No Net Change
Therefore: Create a Micro-Grant program. Establish clear criteria and measurable outcomes. Establish an award jury of residents from the community.
